intro: Lablab texanus, commonly known as the Texas hyacinth bean, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters, featuring trifoliate leaves and showy purple or blue flowers. Its seeds are enclosed in cylindrical pods and are often used in traditional herbal medicine. Lablab texanus thrives in warm climates and is adapted to well-drained soils.
